Jeder Schritt auf den Schlachtfeldern â€“ ob auf verseuchten Planeten oder in den schmutzigen StraÃŸen imperialer StÃ¤dte â€“ schreit nach dem Schrecken des 41. Jahrtausends. Die Bedrohung durch die Tyraniden ist allgegenwÃ¤rtig, und die Darstellung dieser xenosrischen AlbtrÃ¤ume ist wahrlich furchterregend. Ihre Horden wogen wie eine lebendige Flut Ã¼ber die Stellungen der Verteidiger hinweg, und das Spiel fÃ¤ngt die schiere Masse und Grausamkeit dieser Kreaturen meisterhaft ein.

Die Geschichte selbst entfaltet sich als epischer Kampf um das Ãœberleben der Menschheit. Captain Titus, geschmiedet im Feuer zahlloser Schlachten, muss nicht nur gegen Ã¤uÃŸere Feinde kÃ¤mpfen, sondern auch gegen innere Zweifel. Die Frage, was es wirklich bedeutet, ein Space Marine zu sein â€“ eine unaufhaltsame TÃ¶tungsmaschine oder der letzte Verteidiger der Menschheit â€“, wird immer wieder aufgegriffen. Doch wer Captain Titus kennt, weiÃŸ, dass seine Treue unerschÃ¼tterlich bleibt, und dies macht ihn zu einem wahrhaft legendÃ¤ren Charakter.


- Gameplay â€“ Der Donner des Bolters und das Heulen der Kettenschwerter

Das Gameplay von Space Marine 2 ist wie ein donnernder Hymnus an den Krieg. Das Spiel fÃ¤ngt die Essenz eines Space Marines perfekt ein: Du bist kein gewÃ¶hnlicher Soldat â€“ du bist ein wandelnder Panzer, eine lebendige Waffe des Imperators, gemacht um Tausende von Feinden zu vernichten. Das GefÃ¼hl der Macht, wenn man den Abzug eines Bolters drÃ¼ckt und sieht, wie Feinde in Blut und Fleisch explodieren, ist unÃ¼bertroffen.

Das Nahkampfsystem ist eine brutale Symphonie aus Klingen und FÃ¤usten. Die Kettenschwerter brÃ¼llen und sÃ¤gen sich durch die Reihen der Feinde, wÃ¤hrend die SchlÃ¤ge eines Energiehammers Wellen der ZerstÃ¶rung durch ganze Formationen senden. Jeder Treffer, jeder Schlag fÃ¼hlt sich mÃ¤chtig an, und die audiovisuelle Umsetzung unterstreicht dies perfekt â€“ von den metallischen KlÃ¤ngen der ServorÃ¼stung bis hin zu den knirschenden Knochen und reiÃŸenden Sehnen der Feinde.

Dies verleiht den KÃ¤mpfen eine zusÃ¤tzliche strategische Ebene, ohne den Fluss des BlutvergieÃŸens zu unterbrechen. Besonders beeindruckend ist die Art, wie das Spiel die Zahl der Gegner handhabt â€“ riesige SchwÃ¤rme von Tyraniden, die auf dich zustÃ¼rmen, und du allein, ein wandelnder Gott des Krieges, der sie niedermetzelt. Es ist eine brutale, kathartische Erfahrung, die jeden Warhammer-Fan begeistern wird.


- Grafik und Sound â€“ Ein audiovisuelles Meisterwerk

Die Welt von Warhammer 40k wird in Space Marine 2 mit unglaublicher Detailtreue zum Leben erweckt. Die zerklÃ¼fteten Schlachtfelder, die gottlosen Alienarchitekturen und die prÃ¤chtigen RÃ¼stungen der Space Marines â€“ all dies erstrahlt in glorreicher, blutiger Pracht. Die GerÃ¤usche des Schlachtfelds â€“ das Rattern der Bolter, das metallische BrÃ¼llen der RÃ¼stungen und das markerschÃ¼tternde Heulen der Tyraniden â€“ sind so intensiv, dass man fast den SchweiÃŸ und das Blut riechen kann.


- Fazit â€“ Im Namen des Imperators, es gibt keinen Vergleich

Space Marine 2 ist nicht nur ein Spiel, sondern eine Erfahrung. Es fÃ¤ngt die Essenz dessen ein, was es bedeutet, ein Space Marine zu sein: ein Krieger, der in einem Universum voller Tod und Chaos kÃ¤mpft und niemals zurÃ¼ckweicht. Die Mischung aus intensiven, brutalen KÃ¤mpfen, der dÃ¼steren, tiefgrÃ¼ndigen Geschichte und der atemberaubenden audiovisuellen PrÃ¤sentation macht es zu einem Muss fÃ¼r jeden Fan des Warhammer 40k-Universums â€“ und fÃ¼r jeden, der den Imperator ehren will.

Dieses Spiel ist ein Monument des Krieges, errichtet auf dem Blut und den Knochen der Feinde des Imperators.

Uno dei titoli che aspettavo da almeno 10 anni, dopo il primo capitolo. E questo secondo capitolo Ã¨ riuscito ad essere molto piÃ¹ entusiasmante di come me l'aspettavo. Partendo dall'ottimizzazione del gioco, e dal feeling delle armi e delle armature degli Space Marines, ma anche le ambientazioni e le spettacolari colonne sonore che accompagnano il tutto

Rise, Son of Guilliman

After finishing the campaign I just had to write a review to get my thoughts down on paper, this review will contain no spoilers for the story, but will talk about themes, gameplay and performance. Together of course with an overall impression, to start things off.

Space Marine 2 exceeded my expectations by a significant margin, this game is fun to play. I've seen some other reviews talking about how the combat system is "unforgiving", but I can only say that I disagree. The fast paces melee / ranged blend is really satisfying once you figure out what works for you. I played the game on the second to highest difficulty for my first run so far, I had to adjust in the beginning but once I got over the hurdle, quite frankly I just saw myself improving and getting better at managing the fights. To an extent fights in this game feel reminiscent of those from DOOM, specifically Eternal. Every fight is a puzzle that you need to think creatively to solve together with staying on top of incoming attacks and positioning.

Complaints about the AI are valid, but I didn't notice much in terms of them getting in the way of me having fun.

Performance wise, I'm running on a fairly old rig, 1080 and an i7-4790k, and I got stable performance albeit not exceptional on the high preset. For me I am fine if a game runs at 30 as long as it is stable, and Space Marine 2 was, depending on level, either running at stable 30, stable 45, stable 60 or unstable 20-30. The 20-30 range being in some of the later where the game is flexing it's muscle in terms of scale and the number of effects on screen.

As for all the stuff with the Epic integration? Quite literally you accept the EULA and that's it. It has no other impact on your gameplay. I find complaints around this sort of stuff to be valid, if exaggerated. It is okay to be upset that this is "forced" upon you, but I do not think it warrants leaving a negative review for the game, personally.

Story? This feels like it could've been a 40k novel. I say that with significant praise, compared to the first game the stakes are higher, the characters are better, and it just feels like a part of actual canon now.

I am incredibly satisfied, and depending on how the game develops in the next few years, it might take the spot for "My personal favorite 40k game", as it is now, however? Firmly top 3.

Suffice to say, I strongly recommend this game, I will be diving into the multiplayer and co-op components in the next few days, and if there is anything to add or detract from this review, expect addenda :)

If no addenda are found on this review, my stance holds firm.

Co do aspektÃ³w technicznych.

Product received for free

With Space Marine II, Saber interactive proves, once again, that they know how to do action games, this time adding a ton of Co-op & PvP options powered by their squeaky-clean net code. The game runs excellently, looking great and performing to specification. I was able to stream it from the same rig I was playing on, and only got one random crash during my five-hour session. Visuals are great, audio is fantastic, and the writing found here is far better than any game in the genre usually gets. The Swarm Engine that made WWZ what it is comes into play and provides a breathtaking sense of scale to most encounters. The price-tag might be a bit steep, at least when we are talking about the Early Access Versions, but they come packed with the first Season Pass, which will eventually make the investment worth it. If you are looking for a really well-crafted action games to play with your friends, will not disappoint. To War!



- FiOth

I paid $90 bucks for this?...

You bet your sweet ass I did. I cannot express what an amazing experience this was as a 40K fan, I haven't touched anything except the story, just finished it in fact, and I was completely blown away. The scale of the set pieces, fan service galore, and all of the Tyranids and Chaos Servants you can ea- um, annihilate, I can feel the love that the devs put into this masterpiece coming inside me.

If you're a fan of 40K, and you liked the original Space Marine game, or you like hack and slash 3PS games, you need to pick this up. This was a labor of love that we may never see again if these f*cking morons leaving negative reviews have their way.

Some sound mixing issues, very few physics based glitches, and absolutely fantastic performance with TWO, COUNT EM TWO hitches in the framerate in my entire playthrough due to I'm guessing shader compilations. This is the most polished game I played in 2024.

Well, this is my first review.
I'll say right away that the game is quite good, no, even excellent. A worthy continuation of the first Space Marine.
And I want to give credit to Relic Entertainment, because this studio "laid the foundation" of the series.
I also want to thank the Saber Interactive studio for a "quality" product. And a pretty good plot (although honestly it is short compared to the first part (purely my opinion)).
The combat system is quite dynamic (even very much, I want a little "old")
The environment is generally the bomb, you feel the "scope and epicness"
I'll give the game 8.5 out of 10 (Titus does not "read out the thought of the day", you need to get used to the dynamics of the battle)
And the last thing I ask, no, I beg that Saber Interactive make a remaster of the first Space Marine!!
1 hour into the gameplay and i know this game is my GOTY

So far the game is enjoyable but please 21:9 support soon :)

The game has immersive and astonishing visuals and gets really the wonder of the Warhammer 40k universe grandeur and epic proportions. This can definitely give some inspiration and feel of ave to anyone really interested in the 40k universe.

The gameplay is quite a copy from Warhammer 40k Darktide, in all aspects of level design, weapon design, visuals. Unfortunately this also mean the gameplay, weapons design and level design and enemies are as they were in Darktide. This game however is not some aspiring storm trooper learning to survive, but this is a game where the player is put into the boots of a Space Marine, as super soldier with genetic and technological superiority, an Emperor's angel that alone can take tides of baddies etc.

The problems are soon too apparent and disturb severely the feel given to the player. Weapons have extreme recoil, they have too low damage and too low range and in many cases even too low ammo capacity. You get the feel of being scared, alone, restricted... Not the feeling of being the best there is going with brave heart towards what might look as if being suicidal odds and still expect to come out as unscratched and victorious. The devs should at least to a minimum add the target enhancing and dark vision to be constant things for the Space Marines, not some random and seldom few second bonuses. Also while at it the recoil should mostly go away as the guys here do have the power armour of the best sort and the usual recoil from heavy weapons is nothing to these guys. More over the also have Auspex inbuilt to their helmets, super senses, dark vision, automatic sensor arrays around them etc. This should give them really good combat awareness at all times and extreme accuracy with any weapons. The weapons are also needing to get some sort of a update... It feels so sad to fire a large caliber bolter at some hormagaunt to only see that it fights on and did not even lose a limb or so, and this happens with EVERY round... It get so annoyingly sad too soon... For some reason they also chose not to copy the sound from Darktide, and bolters, chain swords, power swords etc. all sound so lame (which unfortunaly is also lame in effects too)... These Space Marines should be able to kill things with far more less effort than the game makes you do especially if trying anything but the Easy mode. Also the Space Marine power armour is merely more resilient than the health and life points in Darktide making the player die and suffer in situations that are barely seeming dangerous.

Please devs, make the above fixes to the gameplay and also add much more damage to every marine weapon and especially the Heavy Bolter, Plasma Pistol, Plasma Gun, and Meltagun all need to feel like they are some weapons of mass destruction even against bosses. Just allow us feel like god-like super soldiers and not some decent elite commando guys... Make the armour withstand things much more... Currently the tolerance is just pathetic... And while at it, get rid of the dodge roll animation finally... Just allow the super soldier to take a quick leap of some two meters or so worth... The super quick dodge roll in a 300kg armour just really is like a bad bad thing for the immersion. Movent which btw is otherwise very nicely done to give the character some very heavy feel otherwise with all the noises and thumps and slight slowness. It would also be nice if you devs could get some effects where the enemies lose limbs and weapons while being shot at and losing capability to attack or move along. This way you can still allow the enemies to withstand occasionally some bolt or two extra. MAybe also make the enemies have some weak points where they are wounded heavily with shots instead of just being hp reduction thing for them. Though the melee blocking and execution shots are very nice.

The game has been developed as being another Darktide with different skin and seems like the devs wanted the main game to be the multiplayer deathmatch / team match thing instead of the campaign where you go against tyranids... If wanting to get a feel of being a Space Marine among a tyranid invasion, this is not so much of a giving the feeling, but just baing visually very immersive 40k thingy then,
